item.title: Roblox: Be Dino Codes (October 2025)
item.description:
Players can find hundreds of different dinosaur games on the platform. But few of them can compare to Be Dino due to its simplicity and diversity. Even though the gameplay is a simple PvP survival, you can play dozens of different types of Dinosaurs. And to unlock new creatures faster, you will have to use Be Dino codes.

Codes will reward you with useful goodies from the developers in this Roblox experience. Among them, you will find both Gems and various boosters. But they should be redeemed as soon as possible due to the short validity period.

Updated October 1, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: Be Dino has a new code available that grants you Gems, dinosaurs, and boosts to help with your progress. You can also redeem the other active codes for even more rewards, including XP relics and extra Gems. These bonuses give you a strong advantage as you build and grow your collection. Make sure to check back often for the next set of codes.

All Be Dino Codes

Working Be Dino Codes

  • AERODON - Redeem this code to get 10000 Gems, 3 Emberjaw Tarbosaurus, 1 Razorback Spinosaurus, and Large Xp Boost. (NEW)
  • YAY10K - Redeem this code to get 10000 Gems, 1 Emberjaw Tarbosaurus, and Tier 1 Small Growth Relic.
  • BIG25K - Redeem this code to get 20000 Gems, Large XP Boost and 1 Medium XP Relic.

Expired Be Dino Codes

  • LIMITED - Redeem this code to get 10000 Gems, Large XP Boost, Tier 1 Small Food Radius Fossil and Tier 1 Small XP Fossil.
  • KING - Redeem this code to get 10000 Gems, and Large XP Boost.
  • DREX - Redeem this code to get Gems.
  • LIKE500 - Redeem this code to get 5000 Gems, Small XP Boost, and Tier 1 Small XP Relic
  • LIVE25 - Redeem this code to get 7500 Gems, Large XP Boost, and Tier 1 Small XP Relic

To survive in Be Dino , you need to collect meat and eggs on the map. This way, you will grow into a stronger predator. Also, a good option to get some food is to hunt other players. But be careful, if they are stronger than you, then you will turn from a predator into a victim. Also, different dinos have different stats. Players can unlock them by finding eggs on the map or opening loot boxes. The latter requires investing a lot of Gems, which fortunately can be earned quickly with the help of Be Dino codes.

Even a few of these Roblox codes will be enough for you to collect more than 10,000 Gems and buy the most expensive Relic Loot Box. In addition, the received boosters will help you dominate in at least several subsequent rounds. For this reason, you definitely do not want to miss out on rewards.

How to Redeem Be Dino Codes

Now that you know what goodies codes contain, you should learn how to use them in Be Dino . To do this, you only need to make a few clicks. Moreover, the code redemption feature is available even before you step into the arena for the first time in this Roblox experience:

  • Launch Be Dino .
  • Then, open the Shop and go to the Code tab.
  • Next, players must enter the code in the corresponding box.
  • After that, click the Redeem button to get goodies from the developers.

How to Get More Be Dino Codes

If you want to be the first to receive the latest Be Dino codes, then you should visit the official developers' social media pages. There you will find not only free rewards but also news about upcoming events and updates:

  • Nibblebyte Roblox group
  • Be Dino Discord server
Roblox

item.title: GTA 6's Next Delay is Already Clear
item.description:
When Grand Theft Auto 6 was delayed to May 2026, it seems fair to say most fans understood. It's true that, over the years, fans have done wild things in pursuit of GTA 6 news, but the general sentiment surrounding the delay wasn't negative. Fans did get an official release date, alongside a window, after all. The biggest factors in that were Rockstar Games' pedigree and history: fans expect it to ship well, having high expectations for the title, even if this meant a delay. Rockstar's history is full of delays, but that's exactly why the second GTA 6 delay is all but confirmed.

Strauss Zelnick, the CEO of Take-Two Interactive, previously commented on GTA 6 's release date, saying his commitment to that day was "very, very high, obviously." However, others have expressed doubt. Well-known insiders Millie A and GameRoll have suggested that there could be a delay later into 2026, with the latter claiming that Chapter 5 specifically is in development hell. Insider Gaming's Tom Henderson also speculated on a delay after hearing "rumblings." Bloomberg's Jason Schreier also previously stated that May 2026 was not a guarantee.

Delays are almost unavoidable given the complications of game development, ranging from tight production timelines to unforeseen technical challenges and any number of other issues, but the above would suggest a question of who to believe. There are plenty of insiders suggesting the delay can and will happen, while the CEO of Take-Two says otherwise. However, regardless of that, I would point to the history of Rockstar releases as the ultimate tell here.

History and Insiders Tell the Tale of GTA 6's Delay

  • Millie A says there are internal talks of a delay.
  • Game Roll (who revealed Lucia's and Jason's last names ahead of Rockstar) suggested Chapter 5 is in development hell
  • Insider Gaming's Tom Henderson speculates that GTA 6 will be delayed to October 2026
  • Bloomberg's Jason Schreier says May 2026 is not a guarantee.
  • History-wise, GTA 6 is on the same trajectory as Red Dead 2

GTA 4 and GTA 5 Are From a Different Time But Reveal Familiar Troubles

GTA 4 was released in April 2008 after being delayed from October 2007, while GTA 5 was delayed from Spring 2013 to September 2013. The PC version of GTA 5 was delayed multiple times, having multiple dates between its initial release date of Fall 2014 and its final release date of April 2015.

Development timelines, expectations, capabilities, and woes were completely different in the late 2000s and early-to-mid 2010s. Come the mid-2010s, essentially following the release of GTA 5 , the entire industry began a descent into longer and longer development timelines, meaning more and more problems would arise. This is best embodied by the development history surrounding Red Dead 2 .

While minor in the grand scheme of things, it's hard to deny that the fall/holiday season remains an attractive part of the year for video games. Releases happen more in spring and summer months than they used to, but undoubtedly, part of the convo is still: which release date would yield the best sales?

Red Dead 2 Sets the Precedent for GTA 6's Second Delay

Red Dead Redemption 2 was initially slated for Fall 2017 before being delayed to Spring 2018 and then again to October 2018. As a whole, that is two delays before reaching its final and fixed date. Reports indicate that Rockstar is trying to avoid the development troubles that Red Dead 2 endured, meaning if it were delayed twice, then GTA 6 is likely in the same boat. One is certainly far from a pattern, but if history is any indication, the second delay isn't just a probability; it's basically the writing on the wall.

  • Red Dead 2's initial release date was Fall 2017
  • It was then delayed to Spring 2018.
  • Finally, it was delayed to October 2018.

GTA 6's Second Delay is Basically Confirmed

Time will tell, of course, but I do think time and history are the real track record to watch here. The simple fact remains: Rockstar has a history with delays, and its last major release—which could pale in comparison to GTA 6 's popularity—had two. I just don't see a world where GTA 6 has any less of a delay than Red Dead .

Grand Theft Auto 6

item.title: Roblox: UGC Limited Codes (October 2025)
item.description:
UGC Limited is one of the few Roblox experiences that is not just a game for your entertainment, but a useful tool for marketing and sharing your creativity. Here, Roblox creators can generate their own codes that other players can redeem to get access to specific, limited-edition items.

We, in turn, have collected some cool UGC Limited codes that you can use to buy new cosmetic items. So, if you want to change your image but want more unique and rare things, this is one of the best options.

Updated October 1, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: UGC Limited has a fresh update with a new code you can redeem for a Waffle Maker. Alongside it, plenty of other options are still active, giving you access to hats, weapons, and cosmetics. These rewards can help you customize your look and stand out. Be sure to check back later to see when new codes are added.

All UGC Limited Codes

Working UGC Limited Codes

  • Waffle1234 - Redeem this code to get a Waffle Maker. (NEW)
  • 714 - Redeem this code to get a Black Valk.
  • 87 - Redeem this code to get a Wheel.
  • 59 - Redeem this code to get Item.
  • 88 - Redeem this code to get Chicken Hat.
  • 801 - Redeem this code to get a Black Horn.
  • Sofa0 - Redeem this code to get Black Soga.
  • BUNNYEARS - Redeem this code to get Bunny Ears.
  • MP - Redeem this code to get Alt Defenders = Mid plate.
  • DRP - Redeem this code to get a Blue Card.
  • TRP - Redeem this code to get a Water Bar.
  • 876 - Redeem this code to get a Blue Hood.
  • TOD - Redeem this code to get a Health Bar.
  • LKY - Redeem this code to get a Green Sword.
  • R3DD - Redeem this code to get a Red Scythe.
  • NYAW - Redeem this code to get a Blue Hat with Horns
  • 404 - Redeem this code to get a Blue Item
  • RIP - Redeem this code to get a Tiger Hat
  • HDN - Redeem this code to get a Dragon Hat
  • SWD - Redeem this code to get Blue Hood
  • 707 - Redeem this code to get Purple Antlers
  • rainglowb - Redeem this code to get Sapphire War Axe
  • Gel - Redeem this code to get Purple Devil Horns
  • DISCORD.GG/CAC - Redeem this code to get Messy Summer Boy Hair
  • ANOTHERCODEWOOO - Redeem this code to get Messy Y2K
  • THANKYOUGUYS - Redeem this code to get Hair
  • REDVALK - Redeem this code to get Reevalk Decal
  • RAINBOW - Redeem this code to get Rainglowb.
  • SKULL - Redeem this code to get Skull.
  • TRICKORTREAT - Redeem this code to get Trick Or Treat Head.
  • THISISAINFSTOCKJAMCODE - Redeem this code to get Jam Fedora.
  • Headphones - Redeem this code to get Cat Burger Pods.
  • Tie - Redeem this code to get Tie.
  • Hat - Redeem this code to get The Neon Tophat of Doom.
  • Cowboy Hat - Redeem this code to get Max.
  • Roblox - Redeem this code to get Star Shades.
  • Poke - Redeem this code to get Purple Noir Valkyrie.
  • Doom - Redeem this code to get Relaxing Pepper.
  • Love - Redeem this code to get Hammer of Friends.
  • Shock - Redeem this code to get DartSky’s Top Hat.

Expired UGC Limited Codes

Currently, there are no expired UGC Limited codes, so redeem the active ones as soon as possible to avoid missing out on rewards.

How to Redeem Codes for UGC Limited

Just like in most other Roblox games, redeeming UGC Limited codes is not difficult, and it is just one of the few actions you can do here. However, if you encounter any difficulties or something doesn't work properly, follow these instructions to figure out what to do:

  • Launch UGC Limited .
  • Pay attention to the top of the screen. There will be a button that says UGC CODES. Click on it.
  • This will open a new menu. There will be two big buttons. Among them, interact with the second one, which says Redeem Codes.
  • This will open the redemption menu. There will be an input field and a white Redeem button below it. Now, enter manually or, better yet, copy and paste one of the above-mentioned active codes into the input field.
  • Lastly, click on the white Redeem button to submit your reward request.

If everything is done correctly, you will see a notification “Code successfully redeemed” and the limited UGC will appear on your screen.

How to Get More UGC Limited Codes

To find more Roblox codes, you'll need to follow creators who use UGC Limited as a tool to promote their UGC. Considering that the audience engagement in this experience is quite high, you can easily find a content maker whose stuff you like and get a code, or become a UGC creator yourself and share it with others.

item.title: Call of Duty Responds to Twitch Black Ops 7 Beta Code Drop Issues
item.description:
Activision has issued a response to Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 fans who are still waiting to receive their early access beta codes after watching yesterday's COD Next event for one hour or more. While early access to the Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 beta is being granted to those who pre-order a copy of the game, there are numerous other promotions currently available with the same reward up for grabs. Unfortunately, there has been a serious issue with Twitch drops that has left many fans irritated.

The open beta for Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 is set to begin on October 5, but there are multiple ways that fans can gain even earlier access to the playtest. For those who want to make the most of the beta before the full game's release on November 14, the easiest way to gain early access is by pre-ordering a copy of the game, which will grant access from October 2. However, there are other alternatives for those who don't want to commit to pre-ordering just yet. Xfinity subscribers can get an early access code via the company's rewards program, and those who have their Twitch and Activision accounts linked and watched at least one hour of yesterday's COD Next event will also be rewarded with a code.

Call of Duty Reassures Fans After Black Ops 7 Twitch Drop Issues

As fans tuned in to watch this year's big COD Next event, it quickly became clear that there was an issue with the promised early access beta codes for Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 . Activision stated that fans would receive a code for the beta, which would allow them to jump in from October 2, if they watched at least one hour of the event and had their Twitch and Activision accounts linked. Unfortunately, players quickly began reporting that while they had received the other rewards, a beta code was not present in their inboxes. Call of Duty has now responded to the complaints and reassured fans that the code will arrive in their inboxes in due course.

As long as fans have linked their Activision and Twitch accounts prior to watching COD Next, it appears that an early access beta code should arrive before the beta begins on October 2. Activision also revealed the full Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 beta rewards during yesterday's event, with players able to reach Level 20 during the early access period and earn an Animated Emblem, Emote, Sticker, Charm, and Operator Skins. While one of the two Operator Skins can be unlocked for all players, there is an exclusive skin only available to those who reach Level 20 and have pre-ordered the game.

The beta will give fans a taste of what's to come on November 14, but it won't allow players to check out every single map and mode from Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 . During the playtest, fans will be able to jump into a total of 6 maps, including The Forge, Cortex, Exposure, Imprint, Blackheart, and Toshin, and 6 multiplayer modes: Team Deathmatch, Domination, Hardpoint, Kill Confirmed, Search and Destroy, and the franchise's newest mode, Overload.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 7
